=== Quick steps to install Ruby using RVM ===

You can use the lastest versions of RVM and rubygems. For your information, we're currently using RVM 1.6.1 and rubygems 1.7.2.

  * Download and run the script that installs RVM (requires <tt>curl</tt> and <tt>git</tt>):
    {{{
bash < <(curl -s https://rvm.beginrescueend.com/install/rvm)
echo '[[ -s "$HOME/.rvm/scripts/rvm" ]] && . "$HOME/.rvm/scripts/rvm" # Load RVM function' >> ~/.bash_profile
    }}}
  * Start a new prompt or load source in the current shell with:
    {{{
source ~/.rvm/scripts/rvm
    }}}
  * To check if it worked, run the following command and it should output "<tt>rvm is a function</tt>"
    {{{
type rvm | head -1
    }}}
  * Install the packages under "For Ruby (MRI & ree)" after running:
    {{{
rvm notes
    }}}
  * Install ruby:
    {{{
rvm install 1.9.2
rvm use --default 1.9.2
    }}}
  * We recommend that you create a gemset for Mconf:
    {{{
rvm gemset create mconf
rvm use --default 1.9.2@mconf
    }}}

Other:
  * If needed, you can specify the version with (for version 1.7.2):
    {{{
rvm rubygems 1.7.2
    }}}
  * To check your rubygems version run:
    {{{
gem -v
    }}}
